item.description: Consists of: Translating real world problems into mathematical problems Solving the mathematical problems Interpreting the solutions in the language of the real world Newton’s Law of cooling # According to Newton’s law of cooling, the rate of change of temperature of a body is proportional to the difference between the tempreature of the body and the temperature of surrounding medium. Proof: Let T=temperature of the body $T_s$: temperature of surrounding medium T(t): temperature of the body at any time ’t' T(t+δt): temperature at any time t+δt
